reporter_caption.center: LIVINGSTON v. TODD SHIPYARDS CORPORATION, 296 N.Y. 854 (1947)

caption.center: HAROLD R. LIVINGSTON et al., Appellants, v. TODD SHIPYARDS CORPORATION,

court.center: Court of Appeals of the State of New York.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Supreme Court, Appellate Division, First Department, DINEEN, J.
opinion.attorneys:
Joseph K. Guerin and Herbert Goldmark for motion.
Jules Haberman and Robert B. Lisle opposed.
opinion.opinion_text: Motion for leave to appeal dismissed, with $10 costs and necessary printing disbursements upon the ground that the judgment does not finally determine the action within the meaning of the Constitution.Page 855
